converse.line: Human, what brings you to my dwelling?
(Whoa, he looks like he came out of a fantasy novel or something.)
Ah, I see. You're like the rest of them. Come to point and laugh at my monstrous features. Don't make me chase you out of here.

choice.line: Yep, pretty much.
Grrrrr!
That's not it!
What is it then that brought you here?
I heard rumors of a wolfman living in the forest and I thought of how lonely you must be. I've come to keep you company.
You must be a kind person. But, I don't need your help. I'm not that lonely. Although, most of my visitors aren't nice most of the time.
Is that why you can't live in town?
Precisely. I don't want to tell you anymore, because I don't like to talk about this. I'll be fine. Just leave the lone wolf to himself. I'll just keep living in solitude.
I can't just stand by and do nothing while you're suffering! I'll try to convince the townspeople to let you live with them. Everybody needs other people's company.
Except I'm not a person. I'm an animal, a beast. Don't waste your time trying to help me.
Did you try moving to another town?
I thought about it, but I didn't want to be outcast again by some religious nonsense.
Good point.
You must have some friends.

Yes. But only one. Her name is Risette. I guess you could call her my mother. She found me while I was still young and took me into her home in Nulato. She is a very kind woman. It was very sad for her when I was exiled.
Why were you exiled?
I told you I don't want to talk about it.
Okay.

converse.line: You won't believe this, Tanvir. I might be able to get you back into town. I've gotten Masaru, a scholar from Mourilyan to fight against Jasper for your case.
That's great! But, why are you doing this for me?
I want to see everyone happy. That includes you, Tanvir.
But I'm not human.
You're human-like, and that's all that matters. You've got your own personality, strengths and weaknesses. You'll get along fine with others, I just need to show them what I see in you.
You're just too nice. You've made me happier than I've been in a while. When is Masaru going to do his thing?

Well, we're kind of stuck. We need a large picture of you to show in front of the town because they won't let you inside and Masaru needs to remind them what you look like so that he can make his point. The artist needs bristles for a large brush to paint the picture efficiently.
I've got an idea. How about you use some of my hair for the bristles?
Won't that hurt and create a patchy spot on your fur?
It's a sacrifice I'm willing to make for my freedom. It won't take long.
1..2..3... HARRROOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
(I think my eardrums just burst.)
Man! That kills! Here's some of the finest grade bristles.
I'm ready to be drawn. Give my fur to Wen.
That girl Wen is quite the artist. She drew me in just under two hours. It looks great, too!
Come here!
Whoa! That's a huge hug!

You have infinitely improved my life! I am on good terms with everyone in town. I can go out without fear of discrimination. Best of all, I am treated like a normal human! I thank you with all my power.
I'm glad I could help, Tanvir.

choice.line: How were you born?
I have yet to find that answer. I think I just popped into existence, or something.
Do you work?
Not currently, but I am seeking employment. I'm quite strong, so it will be easy to get a job in the mines or at a lumber company.
What will happen to your old house?
Once I've finished moving out of it, I'll leave it open for anyone's use. For kids who want to play, or for someone seeking a quiet place.
That's very noble of you.
